From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To specify the minimum timeout period for retransmission of data using TFTP, use the **ip tftp min-timeout** command in global configuration mode. To disable, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the timeout value, in seconds. The range is from 4 to 20.

Examples: The following example shows how to specify the minimum timeout period for retransmission of data as 5 <seconds>:

RelatedCmds.description: Ensures that an interface is used for TFTP booting.
